page.title: 04WESTFIELD CENTRE,BONCHURCH.
page.content: Situated in 14 acres of ground on a cliff overlooking the sea at Bonchurch Westfield Holiday Centre has been owned by the Wadsworth family for 27 years. The main house which is now divided into flats was built for Queen Adelaide. The Centre consists of 64 chalets and 30 flats and caters for approx. 420 people each week, just under half are children. Westfield is open at Easter and from May to September. Most visitors come from the South but during the first two weeks in July many come from Leicester. The centre is completely self-contained providing a shop, launderette, indoor swiming pool, games room, a take-away and live entertainment. There are televisions in every apartment. The apartments are cleaned daily and about 40 people are employed at the centre.
